en: Dead flies cause the oil of the perfumer to send forth an evil odor; so doth a little folly outweigh wisdom and honor.
hmr: Tho thihai chun rim inhnik siemtu hriek chu rim thu an innamsuoktir a. Chuong ang bawk chun, invêtna chite chun varna le inzâkaina chu a suksietpêk.

en: A wise man’s heart is at his right hand; but a fool’s heart at his left.
hmr: Mi var lung chu a changtieng pangah a ngha a, Mi invêt lung chu vawitieng a ngha.

en: Yea also, when the fool walketh by the way, his understanding faileth him, and he saith to every one that he is a fool.
hmr: Anih, mi invêt chu lampuia a fe laiin, A hrietthiemna chun ân hlawsamtir a; Mi tin kuoma chun invêt a ni chu a hril hlak.

en: If the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee, leave not thy place; for gentleness allayeth great offences.
hmr: Rorêltu lungril chu i chungah a tho chun, I umna hmun chu mâksan naw la; Intuklûtna hin lungninawna nasatak chu a sukrê sih a.

en: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, as it were an error which proceedeth from the ruler:
hmr: Thil ṭha naw nisa hnuoia hin ka hmu chu a um a; Rorêltua inthawk thil indik lo suok ang tak chu;

en: folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in a low place.
hmr: Invêt chu insâng nasataka siein a um a, Hausa chu hmun inhnuoia a ṭhung si hai hi.

en: I have seen servants upon horses, and princes walking like servants upon the earth.
hmr: Siehlawhai chu sakawr chunga chuonga, Lal nauhai chu hnuoia kea lâwn ka hmuh a.

en: He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh through a wall, a serpent shall bite him.
hmr: Khur chotu chu chutaka chun tlâng a ta, Dâi nêrâwngtu chu rûlin chuk bawk a tih.

en: Whoso heweth out stones shall be hurt therewith; and he that cleaveth wood is endangered thereby.
hmr: Lung keilûttu chu suknatin um a ta, Thing chêkkhawitu chu chutak- a chun sukṭitin um a tih.

en: If the iron be blunt, and one do not whet the edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom is profitable to direct.
hmr: Thîr chu a mâwla, miin a sîr chu a tâtngei naw chun, Hrâtna tam lem a hmang a ṭûl a; Nisienlakhawm, hlawtlingna ding chun varna a ṭhangkai.

en: If the serpent bite before it is charmed, then is there no advantage in the charmer.
hmr: Dâwivêt a ni hmaa rûl chun a chuk si chun, Rûl dâwivêttu ta ding chun ṭhangkaina a um dêr nawh.

en: The words of a wise man’s mouth are gracious; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself.
hmr: Mi var baua thuhai chu a zainêm hlak a, Mi invêt hmûrhai ruok chun ama chu lem a tih.

en: The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness; and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.
hmr: A baua inthawka thu hung inṭanna khawm chu invêtna a na, A thuhril tâwpna khawm chu intlâwkna pawitâwk thei a nih.

en: A fool also multiplieth words: yet man knoweth not what shall be; and that which shall be after him, who can tell him?
hmr: Mi invêt khawma thuhai a sukpung a, Mihriem chun ieng am a um ding a hriet nawh, Ama hnunga chun ieng am a um ding ti tuin am ama chu hril thei a ta?

en: The labor of fools wearieth every one of them; for he knoweth not how to go to the city.
hmr: Invêt sininrimna chun ama chu a suklungzîng a, Khawpuia fe dân khawm a hriet si nawh a.

en: Woe to thee, O land, when thy king is a child, and thy princes eat in the morning!
hmr: Aw ram, i chung a rik! i lal chu naupang a na, I rorêltuhaiin zîngkâr ruoi an ṭhe hlak si a.

en: Happy art thou, O land, when thy king is the son of nobles, and thy princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness!
hmr: Aw ram, i lal chu mi ṭhahai naupa a na, I rorêltuhai chun inruina ding el ni loa, hrâtna dinga A hunbi taka an fâk lai chun i va hlim de!

en: By slothfulness the roof sinketh in; and through idleness of the hands the house leaketh.
hmr: Zawmthâwtnaa chun inchung chu a chim a, Thabona kuthaia chun in a far.

en: A feast is made for laughter, and wine maketh glad the life; and money answereth all things.
hmr: Ruoiṭhena chu innuina dinga siem a na, Uoin chun nun chu a suk- lâwm a; Tangka ruok chun iengkim a thaw thei.

en: Revile not the king, no, not in thy thought; and revile not the rich in thy bedchamber: for a bird of the heavens shall carry the voice, and that which hath wings shall tell the matter.
hmr: Lal chu ṭawngsie inphur naw rawh, ngaituona khawmin; I khum pindana chun mi hausa chu ṭawngsie inphur bawk naw rawh; Chunga vate chun râwl rî chu phur a ta, Chuong thla neihai chun thu chu hril rawi an tih.
